record.author: Bingham & Sabatier via Stephen Trussel and Gordon
record.notes: A Combined Kiribati-English Dictionary based on the works of Hiram Bingham, D.D. and Father Ernest Sabatier, M.S.C. (translated by Sr. M. Oliva) with additional scientific material from Luomala, Goo & Banner. Compiled by Stephen Trussel and Gordon W. Groves, University of Hawaii, 1978 (http://www.trussel.com/kir/dic/dic_a.htm)
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Central-Eastern Oceanic, Remote Oceanic, Micronesian, Micronesian Proper, Ikiribati

record.annotation: the right, the right hand of, right handed
róko means also; see Bender et al. (2003) given as "come, arrive"
to know, to be aware of, to understand
not sure of -kina bit here, but Bender et al. (2003) give ma-aku 'afraid' and ma-aka 'fear s/one', so I've coded as cognate
not sure of -kina bit here, but Bender et al. (2003) give ma-aku 'afraid' and ma-aka 'fear s/one', so I've coded as cognate
to smell or scent an odour
to smell or scent an odour
teeth, tooth, mouth, beak, point, needle
teeth, tooth, mouth, beak, point, needle
to smack lips, to taste, to suck
to stand up, to get up
string, rope, cord; Pn loan - JCM
to steal, to rob, to cheat
wood in general: trees, plants, stick, switch, rod,
to shoot up, to spring, to grow
to squeeze, to press to extract juice
to buy, to sell, to trade - Eng? - JCM
pound as food with a pestle
to cast at, to throw at
the base, the butt end, the buttocks, the tail
fish (general term), fish of any kind
[<] Pn; looks like a loan from Polynesian
beach sand, sand bank, sandy soil
heaven, the blue sky, the skies
a. to blow as the wind;
b. to blow on, to blow out
"naba" - 'too, also' is the purported cognate - JCM
Bender et al. (2003:292) suggest this is a loan from a Polynesian source
to cover oneself, to hide oneself
b. ascend, climb as a mountain
to count, to calculate, to enumerate, to spell, to read
